To approve and enact the amendments to the Student Government Elections   Policy, as approved by the Elections Commission on March 18, 2019 with the   exception of changes made to the Preferred Names section, of which will be   restored to its original approved upon wording from February 2, 2019.       S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  P RESENTED  B Y   V OTE   The Elections Commission   Zachary Taylor ’21   18–4–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS               Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  March 18, 2019 |  ​ Motion #4     WHEREAS members of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate must reflect values such as   honesty, integrity, and trustworthiness; and   WHEREAS  the Rensselaer Union Student Senate currently believes the provisions for   impeaching and removing Senators are inadequate;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To amend  ​ the Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate ​ , Article IV: Duties of   Office by inserting the following after section 4:   “5.     It is the responsibility of Senators to follow proper procedures   regarding acquiring excuses for absences.   a. Senators shall inform the Grand Marshal of any Senate general   meetings they will miss.   b. Senators shall follow the procedures prescribed in the bylaws of   organizations they represent regarding acquiring excuses for   absences from those organizations.   6.     It is the responsibility of the Grand Marshal to follow proper   procedures regarding Senator absences.   a. The Grand Marshal must inform a Senator if an unexcused absence   is noted.   b. The Grand Marshal may use their discretion in granting absences   for upcoming meetings.   c. The Grand Marshal may consider granting an excuse brought forth   after the absence of a Senate meeting if the absence resulted from a   sudden circumstance which prohibited them from being able to   communicate their absence in a timely manner.”   Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

        2. To amend  ​ the Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate ​ , Article VIII: Removals,   section 1 by adding the following after subsection b:   “c.     Misuse of power for personal gain.   d.     Violation of Rensselaer Union or Institute policy such that the violation   could constitute a danger to the safety of person or property within the   Rensselaer Union or on the premises of the Institute.   e.     General malfeasance.”     3. To amend  ​ the Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate ​ , Article VIII: Removals   by striking section 3 and inserting the following:   “3.      A motion to impeach may be brought forth at the request of the   organization which the Senator represents, or at the request of two or   more Senators. If a motion to impeach is passed by a  ⅔  vote of its total   voting membership, a removal hearing and removal vote shall be held at the   following general Senate meeting.”     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Bryan Johns ‘19   Meagan Lettko ‘20   19–2–1         P ASSES   |  F AILS                         Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  March 18, 2019 |  ​ Motion #5     The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To amend  ​ the ​   ​ Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate ​ , Article II: Membership   by inserting the following after section 4:   “5.    Serving on the Student Senate shall be restricted to Activity   Fee-paying members of the Union.   a. For this purpose, students not participating in the Arch summer   semester shall be considered as Activity Fee-paying members of the   Union from the conclusion of the spring semester until the   commencement of the fall semester, provided that they met the   requirement of Activity Fee-paying membership during the   semesters before and after the summer.”       S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Advaith Narayan ’21   Meagan Lettko ‘20   22–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date:  ​ May 2, 2018 |  ​ Motion #2       WHEREAS Jerry Matthews has served the Department of Public Safety for over eight   years, as Director from 2005 to 2009 and as Interim Director from 2014 to 2018;   WHEREAS he has shown a true dedication to not only protecting the students of   Rensselaer, but also engaging with them as an active member of the campus community;   WHEREAS he has played a major role in the expansion and creation of numerous safety   initiatives on campus, including growing the officer escort program during overnight shift   hours, the implementation of a campus-wide active shooter drill, and expanding the   relationship between Public Safety and the Troy Police Department;   WHEREAS he has spearheaded the initiative for Public Safety to participate in extended   outreach to students in order to make the office a more welcoming and approachable   division of campus for students;   WHEREAS his efforts and services will not be forgotten, and he will be missed by many;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To thank Jerry Matthews, Director of Public Safety, for his years of service to the   Rensselaer community, for his commitment to student safety and wellbeing, and   for his continued willingness to support student initiatives and programs,   2. To recognize all of the contributions that he has made to the campus as a whole,   and   3. To wish him the best in his well deserved retirement.     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Nancy Bush ’19   Bryan Johns ’19   18–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS         Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu

The approve the following addition to the  ​ Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union   Undergraduate Council  ​ as a new article after Article XVIII: Class Council Removals:     “ ​ Article XIX: Undergraduate Council Removals   Section 1: Good Cause   a. Good Cause for removal of any Officer or Representative of the   Undergraduate Council, excluding the Undergraduate Council President, as   provided in the Rensselaer Union Constitution, shall be defined as follows:   i. Two or more unexcused absences from meetings of the Council.   ii. Failure to conscientiously fulfill their duties of office, as defined in   these bylaws or any standard defined by the Council.   b.  Any member of a Committee who has missed two consecutive meetings   may be removed from the Committee at the discretion of the Chair. This   decision may be overruled by a 2/3 vote of the Undergraduate Council.   Section 2: Procedure   a. No removal vote for an Officer or Representative, excluding the   Undergraduate Council President,  shall be made unless an impeachment   vote has been passed by a majority vote at the previous meeting.   b. An impeachment or removal vote may be moved by any voting member of   the Undergraduate Council, as well as the Undergraduate President.”     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  P RESENTED  B Y   V OTE   The Undergraduate Council   Advaith Narayan ’21   17–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #9     WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force was created “ ​ to assess and strengthen the   Rensselaer Greek Life system, and to work with the community to identify what is   necessary to enact a long-term, sustainable, and comprehensive culture change to   preserve the positive aspects of the Greek system”;   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force presented to the Student Senate about their   initiatives and information gathered on September 24, 2018 and November 19, 2018;   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force announced the draft report to the RPI community   through email on January 25, 2019; and   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force is allowing a commenting period from Saturday   January 26, 2019 up until 5pm on Friday February 8, 2019;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To thank the Greek Life Task Force for presenting to the Student Senate about   ideas and conversations surrounding the support of a Greek Community at RPI in a   transparent manner, and for allowing the Student Senate to comment on ideas   presented,   2. To thank the Greek Life Task Force for preparing a draft report of suggestions to   create a sustainable Greek Community and allowing the RPI community to make   comments and suggestions, and   3. To urge the Greek Life Task Force to grant an extension to the commenting period   by at least two weeks so that all members of the RPI community can thoughtfully   reflect on the suggestions made by the Greek Life Task Force.     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Meagan Lettko ‘20   Advaith Narayan ‘21   17–0–1       P ASSES   |  F AILS     Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #5     The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 The approve the following addition to the  ​ Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union   Undergraduate Council  ​ as a new article after Article XVIII: Class Council Removals:     “ ​ Article XIX: Undergraduate Council Removals   Section 1: Good Cause   a Good Cause for removal of any Officer or Representative of the   Undergraduate Council, excluding the Undergraduate Council President, as   provided in the Rensselaer Union Constitution, shall be defined as follows:   i Two or more unexcused absences from meetings of the Council Failure to conscientiously fulfill their duties of office, as defined in   these bylaws or any standard defined by the Council Any member of a Committee who has missed two consecutive meetings   may be removed from the Committee at the discretion of the Chair This   decision may be overruled by a 2/3 vote of the Undergraduate Council Section 2: Procedure   a No removal vote for an Officer or Representative, excluding the   Undergraduate Council President,  shall be made unless an impeachment   vote has been passed by a majority vote at the previous meeting An impeachment or removal vote may be moved by any voting member of   the Undergraduate Council, as well as the Undergraduate President ”     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  P RESENTED  B Y   V OTE   The Undergraduate Council   Advaith Narayan ’21   17–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #6       The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To amend the ​  Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union Student Senate ​  by striking the current   Article IX: Committees, section 7, subsection a, item iv and inserting the following:     “iv Quorum for the Elections Commission shall be  ⅔  of the total membership ”     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Advaith Narayan ’21   Meagan Lettko ’20   17–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS         Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #7     The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To approve the President of the Union’s appointment of Caitlin Kennedy ’19, ’21G   as 2019 Representative to the Executive Board, effective immediately S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Advaith Narayan ’21   Meagan Lettko ’20   17–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #8     The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To approve the President of the Union’s appointment of Dragana Dragutinovic ’20   as Member-at-Large Representative to the Executive Board, effective immediately S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Advaith Narayan ’21   Meagan Lettko ’20   16–0–1         P ASSES   |  F AILS               Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  February 4, 2019 |  ​ Motion #9     WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force was created “ ​ to assess and strengthen the   Rensselaer Greek Life system, and to work with the community to identify what is   necessary to enact a long-term, sustainable, and comprehensive culture change to   preserve the positive aspects of the Greek system”;   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force presented to the Student Senate about their   initiatives and information gathered on September 24, 2018 and November 19, 2018;   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force announced the draft report to the RPI community   through email on January 25, 2019; and   WHEREAS the Greek Life Task Force is allowing a commenting period from Saturday   January 26, 2019 up until 5pm on Friday February 8, 2019;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To thank the Greek Life Task Force for presenting to the Student Senate about   ideas and conversations surrounding the support of a Greek Community at RPI in a   transparent manner, and for allowing the Student Senate to comment on ideas   presented,   2

To thank the Greek Life Task Force for preparing a draft report of suggestions to   create a sustainable Greek Community and allowing the RPI community to make   comments and suggestions, and   3 To urge the Greek Life Task Force to grant an extension to the commenting period   by at least two weeks so that all members of the RPI community can thoughtfully   reflect on the suggestions made by the Greek Life Task Force
S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Meagan Lettko ‘20   Advaith Narayan ‘21   17–0–1       P ASSES   |  F AILS     Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg

MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  September 24, 2018 |  ​ Motion #1       The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To approve and enact the amendment to the Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union   Executive Board as passed by the Rensselaer Union Executive Board on September   19, 2018.       S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Meagan Lettko ‘20   Bryan Johns ‘19   17–0–1         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu    

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  September 24, 2018 |  ​ Motion #2       WHEREAS in Spring 2017 posters were found on campus for Identivy Evropa, a group   classified by the Anti-Defamation League as a white supremacist group and by the   Southern Poverty Law Center as a white nationalist hate group;   WHEREAS on May 5th, 2018, a party was held off-campus by students, partygoers dressed   to represent various countries and members of various ethnic groups, and said partygoers   engaged in behavior that was threatening and degrading to particular ethnic groups;   WHEREAS on May 6th, 2018, a rope tied in a noose was found hanging from a light pole   bordering the 86 field;   WHEREAS the RPI Department of Public Safety  issued a safety alert on September 22nd,   2018, notifying members of RPI of the verbal and physical assault of a student off-campus   who appeared to be “targeted due to his ethnic background”; and   WHEREAS the Student Senate is alarmed and disturbed by continued acts of   discrimination, hate, and bigotry occurring at RPI;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To support any initiatives by groups within RPI with the goal of increasing the   safety and inclusion for all members of the RPI community,   2. To condemn any and all acts of discrimination and harassment,   3. To reaffirm its dedication to creating an environment guaranteeing equal   opportunity, safety, and inclusion, and   4. To create an Ad-Hoc committee, known as the Diversity and Inclusion Committee,   dedicated to fostering diversity, inclusion, and safety on and off campus. The   specific goals of this committee shall include but not be limited to   a. Interfacing with public safety to ensure a safe environment both on and off   campus,   Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

      b. Working with the office of Multicultural Programming and the   Multicultural Leadership Council to increase diversity and inclusion   education on campus, and   c. MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  September 24, 2018 |  ​ Motion #1       The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To approve and enact the amendment to the Bylaws of the Rensselaer Union   Executive Board as passed by the Rensselaer Union Executive Board on September   19, 2018 S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Meagan Lettko ‘20   Bryan Johns ‘19   17–0–1         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu    

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  September 24, 2018 |  ​ Motion #2       WHEREAS in Spring 2017 posters were found on campus for Identivy Evropa, a group   classified by the Anti-Defamation League as a white supremacist group and by the   Southern Poverty Law Center as a white nationalist hate group;   WHEREAS on May 5th, 2018, a party was held off-campus by students, partygoers dressed   to represent various countries and members of various ethnic groups, and said partygoers   engaged in behavior that was threatening and degrading to particular ethnic groups;   WHEREAS on May 6th, 2018, a rope tied in a noose was found hanging from a light pole   bordering the 86 field;   WHEREAS the RPI Department of Public Safety  issued a safety alert on September 22nd,   2018, notifying members of RPI of the verbal and physical assault of a student off-campus   who appeared to be “targeted due to his ethnic background”; and   WHEREAS the Student Senate is alarmed and disturbed by continued acts of   discrimination, hate, and bigotry occurring at RPI;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1 To support any initiatives by groups within RPI with the goal of increasing the   safety and inclusion for all members of the RPI community,   2 To condemn any and all acts of discrimination and harassment,   3

To reaffirm its dedication to creating an environment guaranteeing equal   opportunity, safety, and inclusion, and   4 To create an Ad-Hoc committee, known as the Diversity and Inclusion Committee,   dedicated to fostering diversity, inclusion, and safety on and off campus The   specific goals of this committee shall include but not be limited to   a Interfacing with public safety to ensure a safe environment both on and off   campus,   Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg edu  

      b Working with the office of Multicultural Programming and the   Multicultural Leadership Council to increase diversity and inclusion   education on campus, and   c Working with multicultural, identity, and other pertinent affinity groups on   addressing issues of concern

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  October 1, 2018 |  ​ Motion #6       WHEREAS Nicole Hayden has served as the Administrative Specialist in the Rensselaer   Union from October 2016 until October 2018;   WHEREAS she has shown a true dedication to the Rensselaer Union;   WHEREAS she has played a fundamental role in supporting our clubs and students to   succeed, learn, and achieve;   WHEREAS she has mentored countless students, and has been a tremendous supporter of   the Union Administration;   WHEREAS she has been a major contributor to the efficiency of daily operations within   the Rensselaer Union;   The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To thank Nicole Hayden, Administrative Specialist in the Rensselaer Union, for her   years of service to the Rensselaer community, and for her continued willingness to   support student initiatives and programs,   2. To recognize all of the contributions that she has made to the RPI community, and   3. To wish her well in her future endeavors.     S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Meagan Lettko ’20     Nancy Bush ’19   18–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

      MOTION   Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate   Date: ​  October 1, 2018 |  ​ Motion #7       WHEREAS on August 13, 2018, Dr. Shirley Ann Jackson, President of RPI, announced to   the RPI Community the hiring of a new Director of the Union;   WHEREAS during  the Fall of 2017, a search for a candidate to fill the Director of the Union   position took place, and said search was reconstituted due to a myriad of issues regarding   the process;   WHEREAS the extensive student feedback regarding the hiring process for the Director of   the Union, including but not limited to memos from the interview committee, statements   by the Grand Marshal and President of the Union, on-campus protests, and other public   comments in Rensselaer publications, was largely ignored; and   WHEREAS the Rensselaer Union Executive Board was not provided an opportunity to   vote on the Director of the Union candidates, a prerogative delegated to the Rensselaer   Union Executive Board by the Rensselaer Union Constitution, resulting in a violation by   the RPI administration to uphold their promise of substantial student involvement in the   hiring process;     The Rensselaer Union 49th Student Senate hereby RESOLVES:   1. To express its dissatisfaction with both the recent hiring process for the Director of   the Union as it has been inconsistent throughout its duration, and with the point to   which student involvement was limited,   2. To assert the necessity and momentous benefits of genuine student representation   in operations and procedures on campus, especially those which directly impact the   student body,   3. To insist all participating parties of future processes follow and abide by the   pre-approved and agreed upon procedures regarding the hiring and continuance of   new employees, and         Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu  

      4. To confirm that the Rensselaer Student Senate will continue to examine the hiring   process for the Director of the Union to ensure any future searches for the   Director of the Union position include significant and meaningful student   involvement.       S O  M OVED  B Y   A ND  S ECONDED  B Y   V OTE   Bryan Johns ’19   Advaith Narayan ‘21   14–0–0         P ASSES   |  F AILS           Rensselaer Union   110 8th Street, Troy, NY 12180   sg.rpi.edu
